wikipedia_page.main: John Drysdale (2 December 1913 – 1965) was a Scottish footballer who played for Queen's Park, Rangers, Kilmarnock and Dumbarton. His main position was right half, but he is also recorded as featuring at centre forward (scoring five times in nine league appearances for Rangers in that role during the 1935–36 season), centre half (seven appearances as the Gers won the Scottish Football League title in 1936–37) and right back.

response: * John Drysdale (politician) (born 1926), member of the House of Commons of Canada
* John Drysdale (moderator) (1718–1788), twice Moderator of the General Assembly of the Church of Scotland
* John Drysdale (historian) (1925–2016), British-born army officer, diplomat and historian
